Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an olpe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of animal motif (possibly lion's paw) to right; incised blob rosette with added red as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd possibly belongs to the same vessel as Oxford AN1912.37c and Manchester III.H.36. All three sherds have similar coarsely rendered incision lines.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0301) (Phase 1)
